intro: Alangium decipiens, commonly known as the false spurge or Indian breadfruit, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the family Artocarpeae, which includes other economically important fruit-bearing plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters. Its fruit is a spherical, fleshy berry that turns red when mature, containing several seeds. Alangium decipiens is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has traditional uses in local medicine.
